page.title: 13SHOPPING IN THE SAMPFORDS
page.content: In this area there are no shops. Sometimes a van comes round to deliver the bread or sell groceries. However, the inhabitants of this rectangle mostly have to come into the centre of the village of Great Sampford. One shop is there which opens every day and sells all sorts of things. There is a garage and a hairdressers here too. However, the people usually travel into the larger towns of Haverill or Saffron Walden to get their shopping. In these towns are supermarkets and other kinds of shops which sell clothes, shoes and books, etc. Cambridge is within easy travelling distance and many people like to shop there. All of these towns hold a market once a week and many people enjoy the jolly atmosphere. Also often produce is cheaper.
